div.l: And bi the lyght sche sawh theym both two
But sykerly sche nyste who was who ·
But as sche sawh · a white thynge in hur yȝe
And when̄ sche gan̄ this white thynge aspye
Sche wend the clerk had wered a volyper͗e
And with þe staffe sche drowh ay ner͗e and ner͗e
And wende to haue hitte Aleyn̄ at þe fulle
And smote þe myller on the pylled skulle
That doun̄ he gooth and cryeth harrow y dye
These clerkꝭes bete hym well and lette hym lye
And greythen̄ hem and toke her horse anon̄e
And eke her wey wey mele and on her wey they gon̄
And at þe mylle dor͗e yet þey toke her kake
Of half a Busschel flour͗e wel y bake
Thus is the proude myller well y bete
And hath y loste the gryndyng of his whete
And payd for the soper eủerydele
Of Aleyn̄ and Iohn that bete hȳm well
His wyf is swyved and his dought̉er als
Lo such ys a myller to be false
And þ̉erfor͗e þis Ꝓprouerbe is full soth
Hym thar͗e not wene well that yuell doth
A Gylour͗e schall hym self bygyled be
And god þat sytteth in hiȝe mageste
Save all this company grete ⁊and smale
Thus haue y quytte þe myller his tale ·
Here endeth þe Carpent̉ers Tale
